snippet: Although the average acceptance rate at four-year colleges has remained stable, students are expressing their fears of rejection by applying to more institutions.
abstract: College admissions officers and experts say 2016 is shaping up to be most selective year ever, with colleges reporting that they have received record numbers of applications; high school guidance counselors caution that trend is increasingly making application process stressful for students.
lead_paragraph: Although the average acceptance rate at four-year colleges has remained stable, students are expressing their fears of rejection by applying to more institutions.

headline.main: Greater Competition for College Places Means Higher Anxiety, Too
headline.print_headline: ‘Selective’ College Race Has Students Run Ragged
